intro: Pycnandra obscurinerva, commonly known as the dark-veined pycnandra, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly found in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves with dark green veins and clusters of small, white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Pycnandra obscurinerva is not widely cultivated but is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological role.
